meanings.definition: The quality of being delicate or easily broken.
meanings.sent1: The little bird's eggs were so tiny and fragile, showing great delicacy.
meanings.sent2: She handled the glass vase with delicacy to avoid any accidents.
meanings.sent3: The delicate flower petals seemed to dance in the gentle breeze, showcasing their delicacy.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a delicate piece of glass, in danger of shattering at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The delicacy of the spider's web was a marvel of nature's craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: A choice or expensive food item.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant offered a special delicacy, a dish made with rare truffles.
meanings.sent2: He savored every bite of the luxurious delicacy served at the banquet.
meanings.sent3: The chef's newest creation was a delightful delicacy that left everyone wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The caviar was considered a delicacy among the elite, a symbol of luxury and sophistication.
meanings.sent5: The chocolate-covered strawberries were a sweet delicacy enjoyed by all the guests.

meanings.sent1: The artist's painting was filled with intricate delicacy, capturing every subtle detail.
meanings.sent2: Her embroidery displayed a level of delicacy that amazed all who saw it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was performed with such delicacy that no one could figure out the secret.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting showed a level of delicacy that made it a pleasure to read.
meanings.sent5: The delicate balance of flavors in the dish was a testament to the chef's culinary delicacy.
